description: Pitoun's sequence: a(n+1) is digital root of a(0)+...+a(n).
comments: If the initial 1 is omitted, this is 2^n mod 9. - _N. J. A. Sloane_.Except for the initial term, also the digital root of 11^n. Except for the initial term, also the decimal expansion of 125/1001. Except for the initial term, also the digital root of 2^n. - _Cino Hilliard_, Dec 31 2004Aside from the first term, periodic with period 6. [_Charles R Greathouse IV_, Nov 29 2011]
links: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,0,-1,1).

Lava_, Mar 04 2010]
